languages.text: "В юношестве мы зашивали себе глаза и месяцы бродили по отсекам. Голодая. Выживая. Погибая. У тех, кто проходил испытание тьмой, чувства обострялись до предела. Мы были... счастливы. Ибо благословлены Им. Когда мы стали старше и взяли в руки оружие, наставники принялись испытывать нас болью, и ядами, и тяжестью лживых слов. Со временем наши тела перестали чувствовать боль. Кровь — реагировать на токсины. А разум — на провокации. Мы были покойны. Ибо смогли отбросить лишнее, чтобы верно служить Ему".

"When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. This trial of darkness honed the senses of those who passed it. We were... elated, for we knew we were blessed by Him. When we grew older, we learned to wield our weapons, and our mentors tested us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies no longer felt pain. Our blood became resistant to toxins. And our focus could not be shaken. We were at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."
languages.original_text: "В юношестве мы зашивали себе глаза и месяцы бродили по отсекам. Голодая. Выживая. Погибая. У тех, кто проходил испытание тьмой, чувства обострялись до предела. Мы были... счастливы. Ибо благословлены Им. Когда мы стали старше и взяли в руки оружие, наставники принялись испытывать нас болью, и ядами, и тяжестью лживых слов. traits.locale_text: "As youths, we would sew our eyes shut and go out wandering through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. Those who would pass the trial by darkness would have honed their senses to the limit. We felt... exhilarated. For we had been blessed by Him. When we had grown older and learned to wield weapons, our mentors would test us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies stopped feeling pain. Our blood stopped reacting to toxins. And no longer could our minds be unbalanced. We felt at peace. For we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

"When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. The trial of darkness honed our senses, and for those who survived, it was... exhilarating. We knew we were blessed by the Undying One. When we grew older, we learned to wield our weapons, and our mentors tested us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies no longer felt pain. Our blood became immune to toxins. And our convictions could not be shaken. We were finally at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

languages.text: «Cuando éramos pequeños, nos cosíamos los párpados y deambulábamos durante meses por las bodegas de la nave. Pasando hambre. Sobreviviendo. Muriendo. Aquella prueba de oscuridad afinaba los sentidos de quienes la superaban. Nos sentíamos... alborozados, porque sabíamos que Él nos había bendecido. De mayores, aprendíamos a esgrimir armas y nuestros instructores nos ponían a prueba con dolor, veneno y el peso de las mentiras. Con el tiempo, nuestros cuerpos dejaban de sentir dolor. Nuestra sangre se volvía resistente a las toxinas. Y nuestra concentración se volvía inquebrantable. Y con eso hallábamos la paz, pues nos habíamos despojado de todo lo que suponía una carga para nuestro servicio».
languages.original_text: "When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. This trial of darkness honed the senses of those who passed it. We were... elated, for we knew we were blessed by Him. When we grew older, we learned to wield our weapons, and our mentors tested us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies no longer felt pain. Our blood became resistant to toxins. And our focus could not be shaken. We were at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

Y con eso hallábamos la paz, pues nos habíamos despojado de todo lo que suponía una carga para nuestro servicio».

languages.text: 「若かった頃、閉じた目を縫って、何か月もの間、ベイをさまよったの。飢餓。生存。死。この暗闇の試練は、乗り越えた者たちの感覚を磨いた。私たちは…歓喜したわ。主に祝福されていると知って。成長すると、武器の使い方を学び、指導者たちは痛みや毒、欺瞞に満ちた言葉の重みで私たちを試した。やがて体は痛みに耐えられるようになった。血液には毒素に対する免疫ができた。そして、集中が揺らぐことがなくなった。主への忠実な奉仕を妨げるものを、すべて捨て去ったのだから」
languages.original_text: "When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. This trial of darkness honed the senses of those who passed it. We were... elated, for we knew we were blessed by Him. When we grew older, we learned to wield our weapons, and our mentors tested us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies no longer felt pain. Our blood became resistant to toxins. And our focus could not be shaken. We were at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

traits.locale_text: 「若かった頃、閉じた目を縫って、何か月もの間、ベイをさまよったの。飢餓。生存。死。この暗闇の試練は、乗り越えた者たちの感覚を磨いた。私たちは…歓喜したわ。主に祝福されていると知って。成長すると、武器の使い方を学び、指導者たちは痛みや毒、欺瞞に満ちた言葉の重みで私たちを試した。やがて体は痛みに耐えられるようになった。血液には毒素に対する免疫ができた。そして、集中が揺らぐことがなくなった。主への忠実な奉仕を妨げるものを、すべて捨て去ったのだから」

languages.text: “当我们年轻的时候，我们会将眼皮缝上，在甲板上游荡数月之久。我们会挨饿，挣扎求生，濒临死亡。对幸存下来的人而言，这样的黑暗试炼会磨炼他们的感官。我们……欢欣鼓舞，因为我们知道祂赐予了我们祝福。当我们长大之后，我们会学习如何使用武器，而我们的导师会通过痛楚、毒液与欺瞒来考验我们。随着时间推移，我们的身体不再会感到疼痛，我们的血液变得百毒不侵，而我们的心智则会坚不可摧。一切阻碍我们忠诚侍奉祂的障碍，都已经被我们消灭掉了。”
languages.original_text: "When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. This trial of darkness honed the senses of those who passed it. We were... elated, for we knew we were blessed by Him. When we grew older, we learned to wield our weapons, and our mentors tested us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies no longer felt pain. Our blood became resistant to toxins. And our focus could not be shaken. We were at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

languages.text: "Als wir jung waren, nähten wir unsere Augen zu und wanderten monatelang durch die Buchten. Hungern. Überleben. Sterben. Diese Prüfung der Dunkelheit verstärkt die Sinne derer, die sie bestehen. Wir waren ... überglücklich, denn wir wussten, dass Er uns gesegnet hatte. Als wir älter wurden, lernten wir, unsere Waffen zu führen, und unsere Mentoren prüften uns mit Schmerz, Gift und der Bürde trügerischer Worte. Irgendwann empfanden unsere Körper keinen Schmerz mehr. Unser Blut wurde resistent gegen Toxine. Und unsere Konzentration wurde unerschütterlich. Wir waren mit uns im Reinen, denn wir hatten alles abgelegt, das unsere treuen Dienste für Ihn belasten könnte."
languages.original_text: "When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. Our blood became resistant to toxins. And our focus could not be shaken. We were at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

languages.text: « Quand nous étions jeunes, nous nous cousions les paupières et nous errions dans les entrailles du vaisseau des mois durant. Tiraillés par la faim, nous survivions et nous mourions tour à tour. Cette épreuve au sein des ténèbres a affûté les sens de ceux qui en ont réchappé. Nous étions... fous de joie, car nous savions qu'Il nous avait accordé Sa bénédiction. Plus tard, nous avons appris à manier nos armes et nos mentors ont testé notre résistance à la souffrance, au poison et à l'attrait des paroles trompeuses. Progressivement, nos corps sont devenus insensibles à la douleur, notre sang résistant aux toxines et notre concentration inébranlable. Nous étions en paix, car nous avions renoncé à tout ce qui risquait de compromettre notre mission à Son service. »
languages.original_text: "When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying. This trial of darkness honed the senses of those who passed it. We were... elated, for we knew we were blessed by Him. When we grew older, we learned to wield our weapons, and our mentors tested us with pain, poison, and the weight of deceitful words. In time, our bodies no longer felt pain. Our blood became resistant to toxins. And our focus could not be shaken. We were at peace, for we had shed everything that could encumber our faithful service to Him."

languages.text: "Gençken göz kapaklarımızı birbirine diker ve aylarca gemide öyle dolaşırdık. Aç kalırdık. Hayatta kalırdık. Ölürdük. Bu karanlık sınavını geçenler, bu sayede sezgilerini sağlamlaştırmış olurdu. Bizlerse... O'nun bizi kutsadığını bildiğimiz için sevinçliydik. Büyüdükçe silah kullanmayı öğrendik. Yönderlerimizce acıyla, zehirle ve yalanların yüküyle sınandık. Zamanla vücutlarımız acı hissetmez oldu. Kanımız toksinden etkilenmez oldu. Dikkatimiz de dağılmaz oldu. İçimiz huzur doluydu çünkü O'na vefayla hizmet etmemize engel olabilecek her yükü üstümüzden attığımızı biliyorduk."
languages.original_text: "When we were young, we would sew our eyes shut and wander through the bays for months at a time. Starving. Surviving. Dying.
